Get input for brat HTML widget

doc_data.Rd

These objects are imported from other packages. Follow the links below to see their documentation.

NLP

as.Annotation

as.doc_data(x)

read_doc_data(txt_file, ann_file)

write_ann_file(x, ann_file = tempfile(fileext = ".ann"))

# S3 method for character
as.Annotation(x, ...)

Arguments

x

An object to be transformed.
txt_file

Plain text file with fulltext of document.
ann_file

A tab-separated file with annotations, brat standoff format.
...

Included as a matter of consistency with NLP::as.Annotation().

Details

The as.Annotation() S3 method is re-imported from the NLP package.

Examples

library(NLP)
merkel_min <- merkel

# We do not want to show all annotations
merkel_min$annotation <- merkel$annotation[merkel$annotation$type == "ner"]
d <- as.doc_data(merkel_min)
txt_file <- system.file(package = "brat", "extdata", "sample_data", "edokelley.txt")
ann_file <- system.file(package = "brat", "extdata", "sample_data", "edokelley.ann")
doc_data <- read_doc_data(txt_file, ann_file)
write_ann_file(example_doc_data)
#> [1] "/var/folders/m_/431fjnbs1t32_62d35wvs7pr0000gp/T//Rtmp9zCuGC/file24e14f168c17.ann"
ann_file <- system.file(package = "brat", "extdata", "sample_data", "edokelley.ann")
as.Annotation(x = ann_file)
#>  id type   start end features
#>   1 Person     0  11 
#>   2 Person    20  23 
#>   3 Person    37  40 
#>   4 Person    50  61
